isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - ENGINE, REPLACE WITH SERVICE ENGINE (I-6)

wtsproc.config: This vehicle is equipped with air conditioning and air brakes.

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Remove front bumper.
Disconnect battery.
Disconnect necessary wiring to remove hood. Remove hood (2 people - lift hood from vehicle in closed position).
Raise vehicle. Use blocks of wood under front wheels.
Drain cooling system.
Remove complete air filter assembly. Include air inlet hose to air compressor.
Remove both charge air pipes.
If equipped with air conditioning, evacuate system.
Drain air tanks. Close valves.
If equipped with air conditioning, disconnect A/C lines at condenser.
Disconnect radiator support struts at frame mounted support brackets.
Disconnect all coolant hoses from engine and radiator necessary to remove radiator assembly.
Install lifting device to radiator assembly.
Remove nuts retaining lower radiator to crossmember support.
Tilt radiator assembly slightly forward for access to remove fan assembly.
Use proper tools remove fan assembly (left hand threads).
Remove radiator assembly.
Remove serpentine belt.
Remove serpentine belt tensioner.
Disconnect heater hoses at engine.
Disconnect wiring to alternator.
Remove bolts retaining alternator mount bracket. Remove alternator with mount bracket attached.
Remove bolts retaining fan drive pulley. Remove pulley. Remove bolts retaining fan drive, and remove fan drive.
Disconnect A/C lines and hoses at air conditioning compressor. Remove bolts retaining air conditioning compressor mount bracket. Remove air conditioning compressor with mount bracket attached.
Disconnect exhaust pipe at turbocharger.
Remove surge tank hose from engine.
Disconnect throttle linkage from fuel pump.
Disconnect air discharge line from air compressor.
Disconnect air lines from governor.
Disconnect block heater wiring at block heater.
Remove clamp supporting oil dip stick tube. Remove tube.
Disconnect wire and oil line from oil sending unit.
Disconnect support clamp retaining oil line to engine cover retaining bolt.
Remove engine cover, both sections.
Disconnect air line support brackets from rear of engine.
Disconnect fuel supply and return lines from fuel filter assembly.
Disconnect wiring from tachometer (right rear of engine).
Disconnect engine wiring harness support clamps from engine. Secure harness out of way for access.
Disconnect wiring from starter. Remove left rear engine mount bolt and isolator for access to starter wiring harness support clamp. Remove clamp from engine.
Remove bolts retaining power steering pump to engine. Lay pump aside and secure.

note.para: Do not open power steering system.

step1.para: Disconnect clutch linkage from clutch arm.
Remove clutch inspection cover.
Remove bolts retaining transmission to engine except 2.
Using suitable jack and floor stand, support transmission and front section of drive shaft.
Remove bolts retaining radiator/hood support crossmember. Remove crossmember.
Remove charge air support bracket and heat shield for access to install chain to engine.
Install lifting device to engine.
Remove bolts retaining front engine mounts and right rear engine mount.
Remove engine from vehicle.
Transfer new engine to lifting device.
Transfer necessary parts to new engine.
Install engine to transmission.
Install 4 bolts retaining transmission to engine.
Remove jack and floor stand supporting transmission and drive shaft.
Install rear and front engine mount bolts, except left rear mount bolt. Torque bolts.
Remove lifting device.
Install remaining bolts retaining transmission to engine.
Connect clutch linkage.
Install clutch inspection cover.
Connect wiring to starter, include support bracket to engine.
Install left rear engine mount isolator and nut. Torque nut.
Install power steering pump. Torque bolts.
Install charge air support bracket and heat shield.
Connect engine harness and support clamps to engine.
Connect fuel supply and return lines.
Connect air line support bracket to rear of engine.
Connect wiring to tachometer.
Connect wire and line to oil sending unit.
Install oil dip stick tube.
Connect block heater.
Connect air lines to governor.
Connect air line to air compressor.
Connect throttle linkage.
Connect exhaust pipe to turbocharger.
Install A/C compressor and mount bracket. Torque bolts.
Install fan drive and fan drive pulley. Torque bolts.
Install alternator and mount bracket. Torque bolts.
Connect wiring to alternator.
Install serpentine belt.
Connect heater hoses to engine.
Using lifting device, install radiator assembly in position.
Install fan/clutch assembly.
Tighten radiator support bolts and support struts.
Remove lifting device from radiator assembly.
Install all coolant hoses to radiator assembly and engine.
Connect all A/C lines to air conditioning system.
Install both charge air pipes.
Install complete air filter assembly, include air compressor inlet hose.
Install engine covers.
Connect oil line support clamp to engine cover retaining bolt.
Fill cooling system.
Fill engine oil to proper level.
Charge A/C system.
Install hood and wiring (2 people).
Connect battery.
Install front bumper.
Remove wheel chocks.
Road test vehicle. Check for leaks.
